Sakka's attempt to see the Buddha [dn21:: Sakka wanted to come and see the Buddha
He was prevented by his many duties and responsibilities for the gods of the Thirty-Three
He went to Sāvatthī to see the Buddha, but the Buddha was sitting immersed in some kind of meditation
Sakka asked a divine maiden of Great King Vessavaṇa named Bhūjati to convey his message to the Buddha
Bhūjati said it was the wrong time to see the Buddha as he was in retreat
Sakka asked Bhūjati to convey his message when the Buddha emerges from that immersion
The sound of Sakka's chariot wheels pulled the Buddha out of that immersion
